intro: Anemone narcissiflora var. nipponica, commonly known as the Japanese anemone, is a flowering plant native to Japan and parts of eastern Asia. It is a perennial herbaceous plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features showy, white to pale pink flowers with a distinctive yellow center, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a rough texture and a bluish-green hue. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
